dublin_core.dcvalue: Barriers have challenged widespread telemedicine adoption by health care organizations for 40 years These barriers have been technological financial and legal and have also involved business strategy and human resources The article canvasses recent trends events and activities in each of these areas as well as US health reform activities that might help to break down these barriers The key to telemedicine success in the future is to view it as an integral part of health care services and not as a stand alone project Telemedicine must move from experimental and separate to integrated and equivalent to other health services within health care organizations Furthermore telemedicine serves as vital connective tissue for expanding health care organization networks
International journal of environmental research and public health
